Authors:
Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe, Peter E Mortimer, Chanokned
Senwanna, Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon
Title:
Saprobic Dothideomycetes in Thailand: Phaeoseptum hydei sp.
nov. a new terrestrial ascomycete in Phaeoseptaceae
Abstract:
During a survey of saprobic microfungi in Thailand, a
dothideomycetous fungus was found on a dead twig of Delonix regia from
the Chiang Mai University premises. This fungus is characterized by
fully immersed ascomata under a small blackened pseudoclypeus,
pseudoparenchymatous peridium, cellular pseudoparaphyses,
cylindrical-clavate asci with a distinct pedicel, overlapping
34-seriate, pale to dark brown, broadly fusoid, 79-transversally septate
ascospores with a vertical septum in nearly all median cells. Multigene
phylogenetic analyses using sequences from partial ITS, SSU and LSU
nrDNA and the translation elongation factor 1-alpha gene (TEF)
demonstrated a monophyletic affiliation of the new strain accommodating
the species of Phaeoseptum in the family Phaeoseptaceae. With further
morphological and phylogenetic investigations, we justify the new fungus
as a novel species, Phaeoseptum hydei in Phaeoseptaceae. Detailed
descriptions and illustrations are provided for Phaeoseptum hydei and it
is compared with the remaining species in the genus. An updated
checklist of microfungi, recorded on Delonix regia from worldwide
distribution is also provided
